TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HealthVaultPlatformRecord extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides low-level access to the HealthVault record operations.
Docs.remarks: uses this class to perform operations. Set HealthVaultPlatformRecord.Current to a derived class to intercept all message calls.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordItem> GetValidGroupMembership (Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection connection, Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor accessor, System.Collections.Generic.IList<Guid> applicationIds);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordItem> GetValidGroupMembership(class Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection connection, class Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor accessor, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<valuetype System.Guid> applicationIds) cil managed

Docs.param: The connection to use to access the data.

A collection of unique application identifiers for which to search for group memberships. For a null or empty application identifier list, return all valid group memberships for the record. Otherwise, return only those group memberships last updated by one of the supplied application identifiers.
Docs.summary: Gets valid group memberships for a record.
Docs.returns: A List of HealthRecordItems representing the valid group memberships.
Docs.remarks:
Group membership thing types allow an application to signify that the record belongs to an application defined group. A record in the group may be eligible for special programs offered by other applications, for example. Applications then need a away to query for valid group memberships.
Valid group memberships are those memberships which are not expired, and whose last updating application is authorized by the the last updating person to read and delete the membership.
Docs.exception: If an error occurs while contacting the HealthVault service.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordItemTypePermission> QueryPermissions (Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection connection, Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor accessor, System.Collections.Generic.IList<Guid> healthRecordItemTypeIds);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordItemTypePermission> QueryPermissions(class Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection connection, class Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor accessor, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<valuetype System.Guid> healthRecordItemTypeIds) cil managed

Docs.param: The connection to use to access the data.
A collection of uniqueidentifiers to identify the health record item types, for which the permissions are being queried.
Docs.summary: Gets the permissions which the authenticated person has when using the calling application for the specified item types in this health record.
Docs.returns: A list of objects which represent the permissions that the current authenticated person has for the HealthRecordItemTypes specified in the current health record when using the current application.
Docs.remarks: If the list of health record item types is empty, an empty list is returned. If for a health record item type, the person has neither online access nor offline access permissions, HealthRecordItemTypePermission object is not returned for that health record item type.
Docs.exception: If there is an exception during executing the request to HealthVault.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<Guid,Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordItemTypePermission> QueryPermissionsByTypes (Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection connection, Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor accessor, System.Collections.Generic.IList<Guid> healthRecordItemTypeIds);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<valuetype System.Guid, class Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordItemTypePermission> QueryPermissionsByTypes(class Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection connection, class Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor accessor, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<valuetype System.Guid> healthRecordItemTypeIds) cil managed

Docs.param: The connection to use to access the data.
A collection of unique identifiers to identify the health record item types, for which the permissions are being queried.
Docs.summary: Gets the permissions which the authenticated person has when using the calling application for the specified item types in this record.
Docs.returns: Returns a dictionary of with health record item types as the keys.
Docs.remarks: If the list of health record item types is empty, an empty dictionary is returned. If for a health record item type, the person has neither online access nor offline access permissions, null will be returned for that type in the dictionary.
Docs.exception: If there is an exception during executing the request to HealthVault.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordPermissions QueryRecordPermissions (Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection connection, Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor accessor, System.Collections.Generic.IList<Guid> healthRecordItemTypeIds);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordPermissions QueryRecordPermissions(class Microsoft.Health.ApplicationConnection connection, class Microsoft.Health.HealthRecordAccessor accessor, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<valuetype System.Guid> healthRecordItemTypeIds) cil managed

Docs.param: The connection to use to access the data.
A collection of uniqueidentifiers to identify the health record item types, for which the permissions are being queried.
Docs.summary: Gets the permissions which the authenticated person has when using the calling application for the specified item types in this health record as well as the other permission settings such as MeaningfulUseOptIn.
Docs.returns: A object which contains a collection of objects and other permission settings.
Docs.remarks: If the list of health record item types is empty, an empty list is returned for object's ItemTypePermissions property. If for a health record item type, the person has neither online access nor offline access permissions, HealthRecordItemTypePermission object is not returned for that health record item type.
Docs.exception: There is an error in the server request.
